text: While it's perfectly okay to civilly disagree with someone, I don't think we should call each other out like this.

elements.text: While it's perfectly okay to civilly disagree with someone, I don't think we should call each other out like this.

text: Why is blatant dismissal of marginalization tolerated on this slack?

elements.text: Why is blatant dismissal of marginalization tolerated on this slack?

text: And frankly, that is a public message that I shared.

text: We absolutely should call out behavior, like this, that makes this community feel less safe for marginalized people.

text: It needs to have more opposition than just a few  :thumbsdown: reacts

text: I get the impression that this sort of meta-discussion is definitely politics, and for better or worse there is a “no politics” rule. The previous discussion was already sort of borderline about whether it falls under the no politics rule.

text: Yeah I think this is breaking the CoC, that is what I am saying. The larger meta-discussion is that nobody seemed to care until I called it out.

text: Several people did complain. That said, it's usually best to email stewards and let them deal with it tactfully. Pulling in more channels and inviting pile-on rarely leads to anything good.
